name: Threadneedles Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a very good hotel. I got married at the Royal Exchange and they recommended this hotel which I never even knew existed. After working in the City for 15 years had never even seen it.
reviews.title: A wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very glad we stayed here what a beautiful place. I have mentioned before that I hate staying in London as you are generally served by Eastern Europeans throwing your food in front of you and expect you to feel grateful. This hotel was the exception it was fantastic. We had about 25 rooms for our guests that came over from Germany. We personally had a studio which was felt very spacious and modern. There was also enough room for all my bridesmaids to get changed. Nothing was too much trouble they helped and made us feel welcome at a very stressful time before the wedding. The breakfast was also fantastic for the UK there was a very big selection from smoothies to a fry up whatever you wanted. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in London. The downside maybe is that you are in the City but at a weekend in my opinion this is luxury as it’s not as busy as during the week. You are about a minutes’ walk to Bank station that takes you to Oxford Street in ten minutes. A highly recommended hotel in London.
reviews.title: Great For A Night In London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We've stayed at Threadneedles before, so no surprises for us here. Why did we come back? Several reasons: (1) good central location, right next to Bank tube station. St Pauls and the Thames are both a short stroll away; (2) great attention to guests. we weren't happy with our room on this occasion and it was sorted for us instantly; (3) quality of hotel. well furnished and maintained, clean, good bed, bathroom etc, bar and restaurant just downstairs. polite and helpful staff
reviews.title: very friendly and helpfull staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: At the weekend rooms can be secured at quite reasonable prices (for the capital). My only quibble would be that not all of the rooms are particularly big. But great for a night away
reviews.title: this is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed a seconed time at this hotel and the expierence was as good again as the first time.
reviews.title: We're back, but a suite this time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel direct through the Threadneedles website, as it was a good deal for the weekend and included a Studio Suite room. I had high expectations for the room, given it was a studio room, and having looked at the photos on the website of the studio they were advertising, it looked very nice and spacious.
reviews.title: Not quite 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Arriving at the hotel, the service was impeccable. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful, and the staff are friendly and attentive. The room however, was a little disappointing.
reviews.title: Impressive... and love the Fedora!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the room was lovely and was very clean, there were just a few things that I felt let it down, and made it not quite 5 star luxury it was billed as.
reviews.title: Good but a bit of honesty would have been nice ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: I actually had to ask if we had been put in a studio room, as I thought it was a little smaller than expected. There was far too much furniture in the room, and you had to be careful not to bump into the table or the chair when walking through the room. The furniture itself was on the verge of needing replaced, being quite chipped and worn, where people had obviously walked into it! The room lamps didn't match at either side of the bed, and the pictures on the wall next to the bed were hung so low that the huge bedside lamp completely obstructed them. It just looked a bit thrown together and lacking in attention to detail.
reviews.title: Back again and still consistently excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Although the bedding seemed to be changed everyday, on 2 of the days the duvet cover had rips in it, which just looked shabby. The blanket covering the bed also had a stain on it, but as I never used it I couldn't be bothered asking for a new one.
reviews.title: What a difference another day makes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front of house staff couldn't do enough to make our short stay a memorable one. Rooms beautifully appointed with some great little extras. The bed was just amazing and not a noise from the streets outside! The perfect location for business or exploring Shoreditch, Brick Lane etc.I would highly recommend this hotel and would most definitely book again. Thank you.
reviews.title: Style with substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great weekend deal as this hotel is near the Hyde Park, 2 minutes to tube which is handy. The rooms are very clean. Staffs are polite and decent. It was the best stay at the price paid.
reviews.title: Great Place at the Price paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: It's a lovely hotel, Service great;
reviews.title: Nice hotel but take earplugs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed Feb 2012, travelled as a couple
reviews.title: Favourite hotel bar none

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on a Saturday night deal with my daughter and enjoyed the ambience of the hotel. The staff were all charming, the lounge with stained glass cupola is wonderful and our executive room struck the right balance between style and comfort. However, the sound insulation in our room (214) was very poor and we were woken at 3am by prolonged noise from the room above, which was embarrassing to say the least!
reviews.title: Weekend deals are excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having seen this hotel on a recent documentary we decided to give it a go for a weekend break. We were not disappointed. Our 2012 deal gave us a beautiful suite and a glass of champagne. Just a short walk from the tube and we thought easy to find. The room was lovely- 3TV's (and only 2 of us) a seperate shower and bath. Lovely warm towels, great toiletries. A 6 foot bed. We had a lovely dinner on the Friday in the restaurant (Bonds) and bar meals on the Saturday (the restaurant is closed over the weekend). The cocktails are many and varied. This area of London shuts down at weekends so its beautifully quiet. Shops, bars, restaurants are only a short bus/tube ride away. We walked to the Guildhall to see the Roman amphitheatre and the art gallery, to St Paul's (and a nice lunch) followed by the excellent Museum of London. All walkable. And for us the magic continued with snow. Breakfast (included on our deal) was very good. If you are on a deal you have a choice of continental or cooked. I was slightly disappointed that i couldn't have my usual cereal followed by poached egg- but never mind. All in all an excellent weekend destination. I do think that during the week this would be a very busy place so perhaps not such good value.
reviews.title: A little gem in the heart of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked through last minute.com as a secret hotel and so did not know where we would be staying untill 30 mins from paying the full amount.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took us an hour to find the hotel! We used google maps on my iphone which took us the correct way but the hotel has no flags outside or anything advertising the name, also the number was 5 and the rest of the street had higher numbers so very confusing.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you book this hotel take advice if your struggling to find it and call them someone will come meet you!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, excellent Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very impressed when we arrived they were more than helpful, dissapointed to hear that the bar and restaurant was closed due to improvements as we had not been advised of this. Lifts had to be used by room card by security which we thought was very good idea.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great breakfast

description: Marriott Rewards members can earn and redeem Marriott rewards points at this hotel - part of the Autograph collection. Threadneedles, a 5 star boutique hotel in the heart of the City of London. Relax in the hotel's eclectic mix of old and new design; from the striking stained glass dome above the lobby, dating back to 1856, to contemporary styling in the 74 bedrooms and modern British dining in Bonds Restaurant & Bar. Find warmth in the walnut walls and grandeur in the cool marble floors of this Victorian banking hall, cleverly converted into a five star boutique hotel. Within easy reach are popular landmarks such as St Paul's Cathedral, The Barbican, Shakespeare's Globe and the Tower of London. The West End and Theatreland are only 3 tube stops away. For those who like to stray from the beaten tracks, the savvy guest can also explore The City's lesser-known gems such as chic Spitalfields market, foodie Borough market, The Monument to the Great Fire of London and The Charles Dickens Museum. For weekend visitors, Shoreditch or Borough Market provide some of London's trendiest restaurants and bars just a 5 minute taxi ride away. The hotel is just a 20-minute car ride from London's City Airport, 3 minutes walk from Bank underground station and 5 minutes walk from Liverpool Street mainline station, with connections to Stansted Airport.
